intro: Hippocratea andina, commonly known as the Andean orchid, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, thriving in cool, humid climates. Its leaves are usually broad and革质, providing structural support in its harsh environment. Hippocratea andina is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated for horticultural purposes.
